remoteClasses.name: PointerDetectorFilter
remoteClasses.doc: This type of :rom:cls:`Filter` detects UI pointers in a video feed.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the filter belongs

params.name: windows
params.doc: list of detection windows for the filter.

methods.name: addWindow
methods.doc: Adds a new detection window for the filter to detect pointers entering or exiting the window

methods.name: trackColorFromCalibrationRegion
methods.doc:
This method allows to calibrate the tracking color.

The new tracking color will be the color of the object in the colorCalibrationRegion.

methods.name: removeWindow
methods.doc: Removes a window from the list to be monitored

params.name: windowId
params.doc: the id of the window to be removed

properties.name: topRightCornerX
properties.doc: X coordinate of the left upper point of the window

properties.name: topRightCornerY
properties.doc: Y coordinate of the left upper point of the window

properties.name: width
properties.doc: width in pixels of the window

properties.name: height
properties.doc: height in pixels of the window

complexTypes.name: WindowParam
complexTypes.doc:
Parameter representing a window in a video stream.
It is used in command and constructor for media elements.

All units are in pixels, X runs from left to right, Y from top to bottom.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: id of the window for pointer detection

properties.name: upperRightX
properties.doc: X coordinate in pixels of the upper left corner

properties.name: upperRightY
properties.doc: Y coordinate in pixels of the upper left corner

properties.name: activeImage
properties.doc: uri of the image to be used when the pointer is inside the window

properties.name: image
properties.doc:
uri of the image to be used for the window.

If :rom:attr:`activeImage` has been set, it will only be shown when the pointer is outside of the window.

complexTypes.name: PointerDetectorWindowMediaParam
complexTypes.doc:
Data structure for UI Pointer detection in video streams.

All the coordinates are in pixels. X is horizontal, Y is vertical, running from the top of the window. Thus, 0,0 corresponds to the topleft corner.

properties.name: windowId
properties.doc: Opaque String indicating the id of the window entered

events.name: WindowOut
events.doc: Event generated when an object exits a window.

properties.name: windowId
properties.doc: Opaque String indicating the id of the window entered

events.name: WindowIn
events.doc: Event generated when an object enters a window.
